creator: 2005a@usenet.alexanderweb.de
text:
When a CGI script is called, it does not see the original UTF-8 path in
$path_info but a converted one which is not UTF-8.

In Apache 1.3 on win32, this was different, the script got the full charset.

With this bug, it is not possible to get the path without breaking CGI rules
(request_uri is non-standard).

On Linux, the charset is not affected because path normalisation works
differently there. I suggest to change the charset conversion semantics.

I checked this again today. IIS sends either the PI in the system code page or
if not possible, in utf-8. Apache 2 replaces chars that cannot be coded in the
system code page. Again, this is a severe regression compared to 1.3 and a
problem that even IIS gets right.
